net.openhft.collections

Class ExternalFileReplicator<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.collections.Replica.AbstractEntryCallback
      • net.openhft.collections.ExternalReplicator.AbstractExternalReplicator<K,V>
        • net.openhft.collections.ExternalFileReplicator<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, ExternalReplicator<K,V>, Replica.EntryCallback, Replica.ModificationNotifier

    public class ExternalFileReplicator<K,V>
extends ExternalReplicator.AbstractExternalReplicator<K,V>
    Replicates the contents of the map into a directory, each file in the directory represents an entry in the map
    Author:
    Rob Austin.

        public void putExternal(K key,
               V value,
               boolean added)
        since we are on the only system read and writing this data to the database, we will know, if the record has already been inserted or updated so can call the appropriate sql
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the entry
        value - the value of the entry
        added - true if the entry has just been added to the map rather than updated
